remarks: If ` K ` is relatively prime to ` M ` and to ` N ` , it is also relatively prime to their product.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Feb-2014.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 2-Jul-2015.)
statement: rpmul $p |- ( ( K e. ZZ /\ M e. ZZ /\ N e. ZZ ) -> ( ( ( K gcd M ) = 1 /\ ( K gcd N ) = 1 ) -> ( K gcd ( M x. N ) ) = 1 ) ) $.
